intro: Culcitium sodiroi, commonly known as the Sodiro's culcitium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
